Indica et Buddhica > Monier-Williams > a--anumodita
a--anumodita
Last modified: Wed Mar 30 11:24:11 NZST 2016
A Sanskrit-English Dictionary - Monier-Williams (Version 0.3 RC1) :: a--anumodita.

 

a a

the first letter of the alphabet Page1,1 L=1

a a

the first short vowel inherent in consonants. Page1,1 MW000001 L=1.1

akAra a--kAra

m. the letter or sound a. MW000002 1,1 L=2

a a

(pragRhya q.v.) , a vocative particle [a ananta , O VishNu] T. _ 1,1 L=3

a a

interjection of pity , Ah! _ MW000003 1,1 L=3.1

a a

(before a vowel an , exc. a-RNin) , a prefix corresponding to Gk. $ , $ , Lat. in , Goth. and Germ. un , Eng. in or un , and having a negative or privative or contrary sense (an-eka not one ; an-anta endless ; a-sat not good ; a-pazyat not seeing) _ 1,1 L=4

a a

rarely prefixed to Inf. (a-svaptum not to sleep TāṇḍyaBr. ) and even to forms of the finite verb (a-spRhayanti they do not desire BhP. Śiś. ) and to pronouns (a-saH not he Śiś. ; a-tad not that BhP. ) _ 1,1 L=4.1

a a

occasionally denoting comparison (a-brAhmaNa like a Brahman T. ) _ 1,1 L=4.2

a a

sometimes disparagement (a-yajJa a miserable sacrifice) _ 1,1 L=4.3

a a

sometimes diminutiveness (cf. a'-karNa , an-udarA) _ 1,1 L=4.4

a a

rarely an expletive (cf. a-kupya , a-pUpa). According to Pāṇ. 6-2 , 161, the accent may be optionally either on the first or last syllable in certain compounds formed with a (as a'-tIkSNa or a-tIkSNa' , a'-zuci or a-zuci' , a'n-anna or an-anna') _ 1,1 L=4.5

a a

the same applies to stems ending in tR accentuated on the first syllable before a is prefixed _ 1,1 L=4.6

a a

cf. also a'-tUrta and a-tU'rta , a'-bhinna and a-bhinna' , &c. _ MW000004 1,1 L=4.7

a a

the base of some pronouns and pronom. forms , in asya , atra , &c. _ MW000005 1,1 L=5

a a

the augment prefixed to the root in the formation of the imperfect , aorist , and conditional tenses (in the Veda often wanting , as in Homer , the fact being that originally the augment was only prefixed in principal sentences where it was accentuated , whilst it was dropped in subordinate sentences where the root-vowel took the accent). _ MW000006 1,1 L=6

a a

m. N. of VishNu L. (especially as the first of the three sounds in the sacred syllable om). _ MW000007 1,1 L=7

aRNin a-RNin

mfn. free from debt L. _ MW000008 1,1 L=8

aMz aMz

cl.10 P. aMzayati , to divide , distribute L. ; also occasionally A. aMzayate L. ; also aMzApayati L. _ MW000009 1,1 L=9

aMza a'Mza

m. (probably fr. √ 1. az , perf. An-a'Mza , and not from the above √ aMz fictitiously formed to serve as root) , a share , portion , part , party 1,1 L=10

aGgiras a'Ggiras

m. N. of a Rishi , author of the hymns of ṚV. ix, of a code of laws , and of a treatise on astronomy (he is said by some to have been born from BrahmA's mouth , and to have been the husband of SmRiti , of ZraddhA , of two daughters of Maitreya , of several daughters of Daksha , &c. ; he is considered as one of the seven Rishis of the first Manvantara , as a PrajApati , as a teacher of the BrahmavidyA , which he had learnt from SatyavAha , a descendant of BharadvAja , &c. Among his sons , the chief is Agni , others are SaMvarta , Utathya , and BRihaspati ; among his daughters are mentioned SinIvAlI , KuhU , RAkA , Anumati , and AkUpArA ; but the Ricas or Vedic hymns , the manes of Havishmat , and mankind itself are styled his offspring. In astronomy he is the planet Jupiter , and a star in Ursa Major) 8,2 L=1692

m. N. of Agni MBh. 8,2 L=1693

accha a'ccha

ati a'ti

ind. [probably neut. of an obsolete adj. atin , passing , going , beyond ; see √ at , and cf. Old Germ. anti , unti , inti , unde , indi , &c. ; Eng. and ; Germ. und ; Gk. $ , $ , Lat. ante ; Lith. ant ; Arm. ti ; Zd. aiti]. 12,2 L=2564

ati a'ti

As a prefix to verbs and their derivatives , expresses beyond , over , and , if not standing by itself , leaves the accent on the verb or its derivative ; as , ati-kram (√ kram) , to overstep , Ved. Inf. ati-kra'me , (fit) to be walked on , to be passed ṚV. i , 105 , 16 , ati-kra'maNa n. see s.v. When prefixed to nouns , not derived from verbs , it expresses beyond , surpassing , as , ati-kaza , past the whip , ati-mAnuSa , superhuman , &c. see s.v. 12,2 L=2564.1

ati a'ti

ind. As a separable adverb or preposition (with acc.) , Ved. beyond(with gen.) over , at the top of ṚV. AV. MW001698 12,2 L=2564.2

ati ati

is often prefixed to nouns and adjectives , and rarely to verbs , in the sense excessive , extraordinary ,Intens. 12,2 L=2565

ati ati

excessively , too 12,2 L=2565.1

ati ati

exceedingly , very 12,2 L=2565.2

ati ati

in such compounds the accent is generally on a'ti. MW001699 12,2 L=2565.3

atikram ati-√kram

to step or go beyond or over or across , ( Ved. Inf. ati-kra'me , to be walked on ṚV. i , 105 , 16) ; to pass , cross ; to pass time ; to surpass , excel , overcome ; to pass by , neglect ; to overstep , transgress , violate ; to pass on or away ; to step out ; to part from , lose: Caus. -krAmayati , or -kramayati , to allow to pass (as time) ; to leave unnoticed. _ MW001969 13,2 L=2919

adhvaryu adhvaryu'

m. one who institutes an Adhvara any officiating priest 24,1 L=4772

adhvaryu adhvaryu'

m. a priest of a particular class (as distinguished from the hotR , the udgAtR , and the brahman classes. The Adhvaryu priests ` had to measure the ground , to build the altar , to prepare the sacrificial vessels , to fetch wood and water , to light the fire , to bring the animal and immolate it ' ; whilst engaged in these duties , they had to repeat the hymns of the Yajur-veda , hence that Veda itself is also called Adhvaryu) 24,1 L=4773

anu a'nu

ind. (as a prefix to verbs and nouns , expresses) after , along , alongside , lengthwise , near to , under , subordinate to , with.
